comments.body:
> `Context` is the same dictionary used as when rendering jinja templates.

We need to keep this parameter for interface compatibility.

See: https://airflow.readthedocs.io/en/latest/code.html#airflow.models.BaseOperator.execute

comments.body: This can be misleading as we do a soft delete by updating the status. Depends on response to the other comment in the hook.
I will add this information in the operator's description.

comments.body: I did not write this operator. I just copied it here and made changes necessary for proper functioning.We tried to limit the changes to only those necessary. Otherwise. This operator has no common logic with this operator. Operators are built by compositions, not inheritance.  Common logic is in a different class - hook.  Inheritance would not bring any benefits in this case. Only it would raise the complexity of the code.

comments.body:
I could image operator discoverability can be challenging with many operators in 1 file. I think the idea of having sub directories has been shot down in the past - that would be ideal and would allow us to split this file into multiple smaller ones.

Maybe an alternative would be a file level comment describing the operators in here?
Another thought is that we should consider separating operators related to Jobs vs operators related to transfer operations. What do you think?

The latest recommendations say that we should keep one file for one service.  Airflow is growing very fast at the moment and this is the current way to organize operators. The community is working on other ways to organize operators, but it will be a long process. For now, we can not split operators to multiple files.

I will now add comments that separate the various operator groups.

Reference: 
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_rTdJSLCt0eyrAylmmgYc3yZr-_h51fVlnvMmWqhCkY/edit?ts=5bb72dfd#
